questions.question: What is the area under a conditional Cumulative density function??
Which of the following is NOT a property that the cumulative distribution function FX(x) of a random variable X must satisfy?

answers.b: F_{X}(x)=0 when x tends to infinty.

explanations.a: By definiition CDF is P(X=<x) hence lies between 0 and 1.
explanations.b: F_{X}(x)=1 when x tends to infinty because F_{X}(x)=P(X=<x).
explanations.c: CDF is the summation of the Probabilities of discrete random variables. So CDF is always non-decreasing with finitely many jump-discontinuities.

questions.question: Let X be a real random variable with F_{X} as the distribution function then P(a<X=<b) is given by?

explanations.a: By definition F_{X}(x)=P(X=<x), therefore F_{X}(b)-F_{X}(a) = P(X=<b)-P(X=<a)=P(a<X=<b).

questions.question: Let X is a real continuous random variable then P(X = a) for all a in R is given by?

explanations.a: We know F_{X}(b)-F_{X}(a) = P(X=<b)-P(X=<a)=P(a<X=<b) therefore P(X=a) = F_{X}(a)-F_{X}(a-) = 0.
explanations.b: We know F_{X}(b)-F_{X}(a) = P(X=<b)-P(X=<a)=P(a<X=<b) therefore P(X=a) = F_{X}(a)-F_{X}(a-) = 0.
explanations.c: We know F_{X}(b)-F_{X}(a) = P(X=<b)-P(X=<a)=P(a<X=<b) therefore P(X=a) = F_{X}(a)-F_{X}(a-) = 0.
explanations.d: We know F_{X}(b)-F_{X}(a) = P(X=<b)-P(X=<a)=P(a<X=<b) therefore P(X=a) = F_{X}(a)-F_{X}(a-) = 0.
